Former Vice President Dick Cheney: s statement on Fox News Sunday, where he claimed that President Obama withdrew the plans for a missile defense program based in Poland and the Czech Republic at Putin's request.
The fact: checking process conducted to verify whether Obama actually withdrew the plans at Putin's request.
The initial proposal by President George: Bush in 2006 to install interceptor missiles in Poland and an advanced radar system in the Czech Republic to counter the threat of long-range missiles from Iran, which Russia opposed.
President Obama: s announcement in 2009 of a new missile defense policy focused on countering short- and medium-range Iranian missiles, which relied on missiles based on American warships and sites closer to Iran.
